subj-group.subject: Empirical Tests of Capital Structure Theories

title-group.article-title: An Empirical Test of Stakeholder Theory Predictions of Capital Structure

abstract.p: In developing a stakeholder theory of the firm, Cornell and Shapiro predict relationships between capital structure and net organizational capital. By using a proxy measure for the unobservable net organizational capital and by controlling for other possible causes of capital structure differences, firms with high levels of net organizational capital are shown to have fundamentally less debt than those with lower levels. The results provide encouragement for further enhancement and testing of stakeholder theory as a viable means to understanding corporate financial policy.
